channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: United Auto Workers boss threatens Stellantis strike, says car giant reneged on its promise to restart an assembly plant outside of Chicago
item.description: “The UAW will take whatever action necessary at Stellantis or any other corporation to stand up and hold corporate America accountable,” Shawn Fain said at the DNC Tuesday.

item.title: Ride out future market and economic volatility with these all-weather stocks, Bank of America says
item.description: Investors may want to keep an eye on these stocks to ride out any future market volatility, according to Bank of America.

item.title: U.S. stocks seek to run winning streak to nine sessions — live coverage
Finance firms decamping for south Florida have created an elite school vacuum. Vanderbilt now seeks to fill it
item.description: A shortage of elite school options has been a major pain point for younger wealthy families who’ve moved to South Florida to work at firms such as Citadel, Blackstone, and Goldman Sachs.

item.title: GMC expects to outsell its electric truck competitors as it launches new Sierra pickup
item.description: To do so, it will have to top its sibling Chevrolet Silverado EV as well as competitors from Ford Motor, Rivian Automotive and Tesla.

item.title: Why Wall Street is bracing for a ‘noisy’ earnings update from Nvidia
BurgerFi says it may file for bankruptcy
item.description: That would also be bad news for Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza.

item.title: Lots of drama could be in store for the market in these last two weeks of August
item.description: Stocks opened Tuesday on the flat side, but there is plenty of action below the surface.

item.title: GeoVax’s stock slides 20% after company raises $8.5 million in stock sale
Transgender New Hampshire girl allowed to play soccer, judge rules, challenging governor’s ‘fairness in women’s sports’ law
item.description: The families of Parker Tirrell, 15, and Iris Turmelle, 14, filed a lawsuit seeking to overturn the “Fairness in Women’s Sports Act” that Republican Gov. Chris Sununu signed into law.

item.title: Brits snap up lower mortgage deals as Bank of England rate cut boosts property market
item.description: Britain's biggest high street lenders are continuing to slash borrowing costs after the Bank of England's first interest rate cut in four year sparked a boom in homebuyer activity.

item.title: J&J to acquire V-Wave for up to $1.7 billion in play for heart-failure device
Elon Musk says he’ll take a job in the Trump cabinet if offered
item.description: Trump has publicly floated the idea.

item.title: 'Britain's Bill Gates': Who is Mike Lynch, the UK tech entrepreneur missing after yacht sinks?
item.description: Mike Lynch was only recently cleared of fraud charges in a landmark trial. Now, in a shock turn of events, he's gone missing after the sinking of a superyacht.

item.title: Lowe's lowers sales outlook, cites pressure on big-ticket spending
